metadata.title: CVE-2022-2057 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Divide By Zero error in tiffcrop in libtiff 4.4.0 allows attackers to causea denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtifffrom sources, the fix is available with commit f3a5e010.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm4
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm4
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm4
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm4').
